title: Bigger, bolder, beakier
caption: Thick-billed raven, Simien Mountains, Ethiopia
copyright: Thick-billed raven, Simien Mountains, Ethiopia (© Ignacio Yufera/FLPA/Minden Pictures)
description: Perched high in the mountains of Ethiopia, Eritrea and Somalia, the thick-billed raven holds the title of the world's largest raven. At nearly 70 centimetres in length and weighing more than 1.5 kilograms, it is about a quarter heavier than the common raven. Its enormous, arched bill—pale at the base and close to 9 centimetres long—is the largest among perching birds. These ravens live mostly between 1,500 and 3,500 metres above sea level, found across farmland, rocky cliffs and even rooftops in mountain towns.
